title: After protests, Kenya’s president backs down on controversial tax bill
content: At least 20 people were killed after Kenyan police cracked down on massive protests Tuesday, rights groups said.
summary: At least 20 people were killed after Kenyan police cracked down on massive protests Tuesday, rights groups said.

title: U.N.-approved, Kenya-led security force finally arrives in Haiti
content: The United States has recruited countries and led funding and logistics for the mission, but President Biden says he won’t send U.S. forces.
summary: The United States has recruited countries and led funding and logistics for the mission, but President Biden says he won’t send U.S. forces.

title: Closed-door espionage trial of U.S. journalist kicks off in Russia
content: Evan Gershkovich, who the U.S. says is wrongfully detained, was arrested on a reporting trip over a year ago in Russia and faces 20 years in prison if convicted.
summary: Evan Gershkovich, who the U.S. says is wrongfully detained, was arrested on a reporting trip over a year ago in Russia and faces 20 years in prison if convicted.

title: Israel blames U.N. for Gaza aid crisis amid fresh reports of starvation
content: About 500,000 Palestinians are on the brink of starvation, according to a report by United Nations agencies and aid groups.
summary: About 500,000 Palestinians are on the brink of starvation, according to a report by United Nations agencies and aid groups.

title: Australia welcomes Julian Assange home amid warnings about press freedom
content: There was broad bipartisan support at home for Assange’s release, but some politicians also noted that press freedom has worsened in recent years.
summary: There was broad bipartisan support at home for Assange’s release, but some politicians also noted that press freedom has worsened in recent years.

title: Amid war setbacks and complaints, Ukraine changes another top general
content: The criticism, and replacement, of a top general suggests splits opening inside the military amid setbacks in the battle against Russia.

title: Iran is picking a new president. Here’s what to know.
content: Six men are running for president in Friday’s vote. Only one is considered a reformist.

title: Julian Assange pleads guilty to espionage charge, ending years of legal deadlock
content: The WikiLeaks founder was sentenced to time served and left a U.S. court in the Northern Mariana Islands a free man, en route for his native Australia.
summary: The WikiLeaks founder was sentenced to time served and left a U.S. court in the Northern Mariana Islands a free man, en route for his native Australia.

content: Assange’s life and work remain the source of much febrile debate, across the political spectrum and around the world.

title: U.S. and Philippines seek to de-escalate after sea skirmish with China

title: International Court issues warrants for top Russian military officials
content: The warrants say Sergei Shoigu, the former defense minister, and Valery Gerasimov, army chief of staff, were responsible for the war crimes by targeting civilian infrastructure.

title: Even among world leaders, Biden and Trump are old

title: For this U.S. airman, the Gaza war hit too close to home
content: Mohammed Abu Hashem ended a 22-year Air Force career after his aunt was killed in an Israeli strike. “I can’t be part of the system that enabled this,” he says.
summary: Mohammed Abu Hashem ended a 22-year Air Force career after his aunt was killed in an Israeli strike. “I can’t be part of the system that enabled this,” he says.

title: What to know about WikiLeaks’ Julian Assange and the deal set to free him

title: This art museum has a new home for its Picassos: The women’s bathroom
content: A court ruled that the Museum of Old and New Art in Australia must admit men to a women-only lounge. So it moved some of its art to a ladies’ restroom.
summary: A court ruled that the Museum of Old and New Art in Australia must admit men to a women-only lounge. So it moved some of its art to a ladies’ restroom.

content: The sprawling drama involved hacking and leaking, flight and imprisonment, and the governments of the U.S., Britain, Sweden, Ecuador and Australia.
summary: The sprawling drama involved hacking and leaking, flight and imprisonment, and the governments of the U.S., Britain, Sweden, Ecuador and Australia.

title: O Canada! Is this the year the Stanley Cup drought ends?
content: The Edmonton Oilers are looking to become the first Canadian NHL team to hoist the Stanley Cup since 1993.
